bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, March 27, 1912

div1.p: These excerpts regard the correspondence between William T. Jenkins and Jefferson Randolph Kean, and the confusion of Jenkins' mailing address. The record card is dated March 27, 1912 through April 20, 1912. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, March 27, 1912
div1.p:
10. March, 27, 1912, Wm. T. Jenkins, M.D.
------------------------------
The New York Herald, New York City, N.Y
March, 24, 1912. Requests copy of the lif
life of Major Walter Reed, M.C., and any
reprints or reports made by him and
the board of which he was Chairman on
the investigation of Yellow Fever.
A.G., refers to the S.G. WG

10 Mar. 27, 1912. Dr. William T. Jenkins
The New York Herald, N. Y. City. Sir: I
am directed by the Surgeon General
to acknowledge the receipt by refer-
ence of your letter of Mar. 24th ad-
dressed to The Adjt. General. In com-
pliance with your request I take
pleasure in sending you under sepa-
rate cover a copy of Senate Document
No. 822, entitled “Yellow Fever - A Com-
pilation of Various Publications,”
which will furnish detailed informa-
tion regarding the work of Maj. Reed
and the Yellow Fever Commission.

J.R.K., Lt. Col., M.C., U. S. A.
(AG)BMI

Wm. T. Jenkins, New York City, Apr.
8, 1912, acknowledges receipt of letter
of the 27th ult., and that because of
being addressed to the NY Herald instead
of the NY Herald Ship News it was re-
turned to Washington and readdressed;
that he has received the letter but
lost the document, and asks that anoth
er copy be sent him (Yellow Fever) to
the Herald Ship News, Staten Island.
K

Memo - For letter to Director, Yellow
Fever Bureau Liverpool, England,
regarding the share of work performed
by A. Agramonte, M.D. as member
of the U. S. Commission which
demonstrated the transmission
of yellow fever by the agency of
the Stegomyia mosquito, refer
38657[unclear] S.G.O. 1912.
N.
